short: Move cursor to end of input when entering insert mode
description: Controls whether the cursor is automatically moved to the end of input or textarea elements when SurfingKeys enters Insert mode. When enabled (true), entering Insert mode on an input element will position the cursor at the end of the text content, which is useful when you want to append text to existing input values. When disabled (false), the cursor position is left unchanged, allowing you to edit at the current cursor position or at the beginning of the input. This setting does not apply to SELECT elements, which have their own focus behavior.
valueDescription: Boolean flag to control whether cursor is moved to the end of input elements when entering insert mode

notes: This is a boolean setting that controls cursor positioning behavior when entering Insert mode on input and textarea elements. The default value (true) automatically positions the cursor at the end of the input text, which is convenient for appending new text. This behavior is skipped for SELECT elements, which have their own native focus handling. When set to false, the cursor position is left as-is, allowing users to edit at specific positions within the input field. This setting works in conjunction with the keepCursor parameter passed to the enter function; if keepCursor is true, the cursor will not be moved regardless of this setting value.
